## Investments worth ₹ 29 to 30 trillion expected between Fiscal 2026 to 2030 as India aims for 500 GW of RE capacity by 2030

Crisil Intelligence projects investments of ₹ 29 to 30 trillion in the power sector between fiscal 2026 to 2030. Investments in power generation are expected to increase approximately 1.7 times from ₹ 11.6 trillion between fiscals 2019 to 2025 to ₹ 19 to 21 trillion between fiscals 2026 to 2030. Investments in renewable energy (excluding hydro, pumped storage and BESS) generation capacity are expected to account for 70% of these investments over the same period as India seeks to achieve its 500 GW of non-fossil energy capacity announced in COP26.

To achieve the RE generation target, strong transmission infrastructure is needed so as to integrate large scale RE capacities into the grid. This is expected to lead to transmission investments of ₹ 4.5 to 5.5 trillion between fiscals 2026 to 2030 from approximately ₹ 3.2 trillion between fiscals 2019 to 2025 led by upcoming ISTS projects.

Additionally, Crisil Intelligence expects ₹ 3.5 to 4.5 trillion worth of investments in the distribution segment between fiscal 2026 to 2030 driven by upgradation of distribution infrastructure along with installation of smart meters as India focuses on reduction of its carbon emission.
